featureResponse.summary: A young woman unleashes the diabolical Djinn once again in this terrifying fourth adventure that finds the evil wish-giver hatching a plot to have his race take over Earth. Starring Tara Spencer-Nairn, Michael Trucco, Jason Thompson and John Novak.

featureResponse.title: Wish I Was Here
featureResponse.shortSummary: Zach Braff directed and stars in this film about a struggling actor and father of two who faces a crossroads in his life.
featureResponse.summary: Zach Braff ('Garden State') directed and stars in this 'funny and emotionally satisfying' (Hollywood Reporter) film about a struggling actor and father of two who faces a crossroads in his life when he learns his father is dying and will no longer be able to pay for his children's education.

featureResponse.title: Wit
featureResponse.shortSummary: Emma Thompson stars as a single-minded English professor who finds enlightenment through her struggle with cancer.
featureResponse.summary: Two-time Oscar(R)-winner Emma Thompson ('Howards End,' 'Sense and Sensibility') stars as Vivian Bearing, a single-minded English professor, who in the face of imminent death learns the power and importance of simple acts of human kindness. Christopher Lloyd, Eileen Atkins, Audra McDonald, Jonathan M. Woodward and Harold Pinter round out a first-rate cast.

featureResponse.title: Without a Trace
featureResponse.shortSummary: A six-year-old boy disappears, prompting a massive search in this highly charged drama.
featureResponse.summary: Six-year old Alex gets up one morning, dresses for school, waves goodbye to his mother...and disappears. As the police mount a massive effort to find the child, his mother struggles to bear the harrowing anxiety. Kate Nelligan as the distraught mother and Judd Hirsch as a sympathetic police detective both give riveting performances in this charged drama.

featureResponse.title: Wonder Boys
featureResponse.shortSummary: Michael Douglas is a college professor and struggling author whose life goes into a tailspin over the course of one disastrous weekend.
featureResponse.summary: Michael Douglas delivers one of his finest performances in this 'superbly mounted screwball comedy' (Variety) about a college professor and struggling author whose life goes into a tailspin over the course of one disastrous weekend. Tobey Maguire, Frances McDormand, Katie Holmes, Rip Torn and Robert Downey Jr. co-star. Oscar(R) winner for Best Original Song.

featureResponse.title: Wonder Woman
featureResponse.shortSummary: Amazon princess Diana attempts to capture Ares, the God of War, before he destroys the human race, in this animated adventure.
featureResponse.summary: Keri Russell provides the voice of Amazon princess Diana in this thrilling animated adventure about the super heroine's attempts to capture Ares, the God of War, before he destroys the human race.

featureResponse.title: Worth Winning
featureResponse.shortSummary: Single, successful guy Mark Harmon bets he can become engaged to three beauties in three months in this comedy.
featureResponse.summary: Can a man have it all? Mark Harmon gives it his best Yuppie shot in this comedy of dating, mating and marriage. On a bet, Harmon sets out to become engaged to three beauties in three months. Madeleine Stowe and Lesley Ann Warren co-star in the hijinks as Mr. Wonderful takes a tumble into triple-timing fun. What do women want? In this wacky case, big-time revenge!

featureResponse.title: X-Men: Days of Future Past
featureResponse.shortSummary: Characters from the original X-Men movies join forces with their younger selves to go back in time to prevent their annihilation by robots.
featureResponse.summary: The X-Men unite in this "spectacular" (Chicago Tribune) "adrenaline-fueled" (NY Daily News) blockbuster. As gigantic Sentinel robots annihilate mutants, characters from the original X-Men movies join forces with their younger selves to go back in time and alter history before it's too late.

featureResponse.title: Yesterday
featureResponse.shortSummary: Oscar(R)-nominated Best Foreign Language Film about an African woman with AIDS who vows to live to see her daughter go to school.
featureResponse.summary: In a place where life is full of adversity, one woman shows how courage, compassion and love can change the course of tomorrow. This 2004 Oscar(R) nominee for Best Foreign Language Film puts a human face on the politics and statistics of the AIDS crisis in Africa through the story of a woman dying of the disease who vows to live to see her daughter go to school.

featureResponse.title: You Don't Know Jack
featureResponse.shortSummary: Al Pacino stars as Dr. Jack Kevorkian, the infamous "Doctor Death" who became the poster child for assisted suicide in the 1990s.
featureResponse.summary: Angel of mercy...or Doctor Death? In the 1990s, Dr. Jack Kevorkian became one of the most polarizing figures in modern American history. Al Pacino brings Dr. Death to life in 'You Don't Know Jack,' a Barry Levinson film that follows him through his first assisted suicide, the media frenzy that followed and the decade-long war of wills between Kevorkian and state prosecutors.

featureResponse.shortTitle: Zip and Zap and the Marble Gang
featureResponse.title: Zipi y Zape y el club de la canica (Zip and Zap and the Marble Gang)
featureResponse.shortSummary: Two rambunctious friends stuck in an ultra-strict summer school take on the stern headmaster while searching for hidden treasure.
featureResponse.summary: Two rambunctious friends stuck in an ultra-strict summer school take on the stern headmaster while searching for hidden treasure in this adventure tale.

featureResponse.shortSummary: A wild series of events and characters converge at 11:14 PM in a small town in this finely crafted tale.
featureResponse.summary: A wild series of events and characters converge at 11:14 PM in a small town in this finely crafted tale. A hit-and-run, teen pranksters, drinking and driving and even severed male private parts play into the intriguing storyline.

featureResponse.title: The 25th Hour
featureResponse.shortSummary: The day before he has to report to prison for seven years, a Manhattan drug dealer tries to reconnect with family and friends.
featureResponse.summary: The day before he has to report to prison for seven years, a Manhattan drug dealer reflects on his life and tries to reconnect with family and friends in the wake of 9/11.

featureResponse.title: 5 Flights Up
featureResponse.shortSummary: Downsizing lands aging New York City couple Morgan Freeman and Diane Keaton in the midst of a riotous real-estate circus in this comedy.
featureResponse.summary: Downsizing lands aging New York City couple Morgan Freeman and Diane Keaton in the midst of a riotous real-estate circus in this comedy. Selling the fifth-floor walkup they've owned for more than 40 years is difficult, but it's not nearly as rough as dealing with realtors and screwball buyers, serious or otherwise. Cynthia Nixon ('Sex and the City') co-stars.

featureResponse.title: 7 Cajas (7 Boxes)
featureResponse.shortSummary: A delivery boy finds himself in a life-and-death chase after accepting $100 to transport seven mysterious boxes to a Paraguayan market.
featureResponse.summary: A teenage delivery boy finds himself in a life-and-death chase after accepting $100 to transport seven mysterious boxes to an outdoor Paraguayan market. "Breathtaking action and suspense, humor and appealing characters all in one visually flashy package" (Indiewire.com).

featureResponse.title: 10 Things I Hate About You
featureResponse.shortSummary: An overprotective father forbids his youngest daughter to date until her older sister finds a beau.
featureResponse.summary: In this "sharp and snappy" (L.A. Times) teen riff on Shakespeare's "The Taming of the Shrew," an overprotective father forbids his youngest daughter to date until her older sister finds a beau. So little sis plots to find a boyfriend for her man-hating sibling.

featureResponse.title: 27 Dresses
featureResponse.shortSummary: A seasoned bridesmaid preps for her sister's big day despite her feelings for the groom in this romantic comedy.
featureResponse.summary: Bridal party veteran Jane Nichols has walked the aisle for 27 friends as they married--and she has all the dresses to prove it. But when Jane's bratty sister plans to marry the very man Jane quietly adores, will she stand up as a bridesmaid for her sis...or for once stand up for herself? With a columnist chronicling the wedding, it's sure to be a comical trip to the altar.
